caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}."}],"AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount(address,bytes32)":[{"details":"The `account` is missing a role."}],"EnforcedPause()":[{"details":"The operation failed because the contract is paused."}],"ExpectedPause()":[{"details":"The operation failed because the contract is not paused."}],"ReentrancyGuardReentrantCall()":[{"details":"Unauthorized reentrant call."}],"SafeERC20FailedOperation(address)":[{"details":"An operation with an ERC-20 token failed."}]},"events":{"InterestRoutingFailed(uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Emitted when interest routing to SMUSD fails (e.g. supply cap hit)"},"Paused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account`."},"ReservesMintFailed(address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when reserve minting fails"},"RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted to signal this."},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Unpaused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"borrow(uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount of mUSD to borrow (18 decimals)"}},"borrowFor(address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount of mUSD to borrow (18 decimals)","user":"The user to borrow for"}},"coverBadDebt(uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount of bad debt to cover (mUSD, 18 decimals)"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"healthFactor(address)":{"returns":{"_0":"Health factor in basis points (10000 = 1.0)"}},"healthFactorUnsafe(address)":{"details":"Used by LiquidationEngine so liquidations proceed during >20% price crashes. Without this, healthFactor() reverts via getValueUsd() circuit breaker, blocking all liquidations exactly when they are most needed.","returns":{"_0":"Health factor in basis points (10000 = 1.0)"}},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"recordBadDebt(address)":{"params":{"user":"The borrower whose remaining debt is uncollectible"}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"repay(uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount of mUSD to repay (18 decimals) Removed whenNotPaused \u2014 users must always be able to repay debt, even during a pause, to avoid unfair liquidation from accruing interest."}},"repayFor(address,uint256)":{"details":"Allows LeverageVault to repay user debt when closing positions","params":{"amount":"Amount of mUSD to repay (18 decimals) Removed whenNotPaused \u2014 repayment must always be available.","user":"The user whose debt to repay"}},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"setTimelock(address)":{"details":"Must be called *through* the current timelock (i.e. scheduled +      executed as a normal timelocked operation)."},"socializeBadDebt(uint256,address[])":{"details":"Socializes bad debt by proportionally reducing each active borrower's debt, maintaining the invariant sum(user_debts) == totalBorrows. Without proportional reduction, totalBorrows drops below user sums, breaking interest accrual math (overallocation via proportional share).","params":{"amount":"Amount of bad debt to socialize","borrowers":"Array of active borrower addresses whose debt should be reduced"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas."},"totalDebt(address)":{"details":"Uses pos.principal + pos.accruedInterest (total debt) as interest base, matching _accrueInterest() execution. Previously used only pos.principal, causing the view to understate pending interest vs what _accrueInterest actually charges."},"withdrawCollateral(address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount to withdraw Checks health BEFORE withdrawal (CEI pattern)","token":"The collateral token"}}},"stateVariables":{"badDebt":{"details":"When a liquidation exhausts all collateral but debt remains, the residual debt is written off the user's position and accumulated here. This represents mUSD in circulation that is no longer collateral-backed."},"unroutedInterest":{"details":"Tracked separately so totalBorrows stays in sync with actual mUSD supply. Cleared when a subsequent mint succeeds or admin calls drainUnroutedInterest()."}},"title":"BorrowModule","version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"BadDebtCovered(uint256,uint256,string)":{"notice":"Emitted when bad debt is covered (burned from reserves or injection)"},"BadDebtRecorded(address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when bad debt is recorded from an underwater liquidation"},"BadDebtSocialized(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when bad debt is socialized across the protocol"},"UnroutedInterestDrained(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Drain unrouted interest to correct totalBorrows divergence. When supply cap exhaustion prevents minting mUSD for supplier interest, `unroutedInterest` accumulates while `totalBorrows` keeps growing. This function reconciles by subtracting the unrouted amount from totalBorrows."}},"kind":"user","methods":{"badDebt()":{"notice":"Accumulated bad debt from underwater liquidations (unbacked mUSD)"},"badDebtCovered()":{"notice":"Total bad debt covered by protocol reserves or external injection"},"borrow(uint256)":{"notice":"Borrow mUSD against deposited collateral"},"borrowCapacity(address)":{"notice":"Get total borrow capacity for a user (public wrapper)"},"borrowFor(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Borrow mUSD on behalf of a user (for LeverageVault integration)"},"coverBadDebt(uint256)":{"notice":"Cover bad debt by burning mUSD from protocol reserves. Admin sends mUSD to this contract, which is burned to reduce the unbacked supply. Reduces the badDebt accumulator accordingly."},"cumulativeBadDebt()":{"notice":"Total bad debt ever recorded (for analytics, never decremented)"},"getCurrentBorrowRate()":{"notice":"Get current annual borrow rate in BPS"},"getCurrentSupplyRate()":{"notice":"Get current annual supply rate in BPS"},"getTotalSupply()":{"notice":"Get total supply used for utilization calculation"},"getUtilizationRate()":{"notice":"Get current utilization rate in BPS"},"healthFactor(address)":{"notice":"Get health factor for a user (public view)"},"healthFactorUnsafe(address)":{"notice":"Health factor using unsafe oracle (bypasses circuit breaker)"},"interestRateBps()":{"notice":"Fallback fixed rate if model not set (legacy compatibility)"},"interestRateModel()":{"notice":"Dynamic interest rate model (utilization-based)"},"lastGlobalAccrualTime()":{"notice":"Last time global interest was accrued"},"maxBorrow(address)":{"notice":"Get maximum additional borrow amount for a user"},"pause()":{"notice":"Pause borrowing and repayments"},"protocolReserves()":{"notice":"Accumulated protocol reserves (from reserve factor)"},"recordBadDebt(address)":{"notice":"Record bad debt from underwater liquidation. Called by LiquidationEngine after a liquidation exhausts all collateral on a borrower who still has residual debt. Writes off the user's position and moves the shortfall into the badDebt accumulator."},"reduceDebt(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Called by LiquidationEngine or LeverageVault to reduce a user's debt after seizure/emergency close Added nonReentrant to match all other state-modifying debt functions Allow LEVERAGE_VAULT_ROLE to call for emergency debt cleanup"},"repay(uint256)":{"notice":"Repay mUSD debt"},"repayFor(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Repay mUSD debt on behalf of a user (for LeverageVault integration)"},"setInterestRate(uint256)":{"notice":"Set interest rate (timelocked via MintedTimelockController)"},"setInterestRateModel(address)":{"notice":"Set interest rate model (timelocked via MintedTimelockController)"},"setMinDebt(uint256)":{"notice":"Set min debt threshold (timelocked via MintedTimelockController)"},"setSMUSD(address)":{"notice":"Set SMUSD vault (timelocked via MintedTimelockController)"},"setTimelock(address)":{"notice":"Migrate to a new timelock controller."},"setTreasury(address)":{"notice":"Set Treasury (timelocked via MintedTimelockController)"},"smusd()":{"notice":"SMUSD vault to receive interest payments"},"socializeBadDebt(uint256,address[])":{"notice":"Socialize remaining bad debt by reducing totalBorrows. This effectively distributes the loss across all borrowers by slightly reducing the interest base. Should only be used as a last resort when reserves are insufficient."},"timelock()":{"notice":"Address of the MintedTimelockController that gates admin ops"},"totalBorrows()":{"notice":"Global total borrows across all users"},"totalDebt(address)":{"notice":"Get total debt (principal + accrued interest) for a user"},"totalInterestPaidToSuppliers()":{"notice":"Total interest paid to suppliers (for analytics)"},"treasury()":{"notice":"Treasury for total supply calculation"},"unpause()":{"notice":"Unpause borrowing and repayments Require DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE for separation of duties"},"unroutedInterest()":{"notice":"Interest that accrued as debt but couldn't be minted (supply cap hit)"},"withdrawCollateral(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Withdraw collateral (only if position stays healthy)"},"withdrawReserves(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Withdraw accumulated protocol reserves Reserves are accounting entries for the protocol's share of interest. Instead of minting unbacked mUSD (which dilutes the peg), we try to mint within the supply cap. If the cap is hit, the withdrawal fails gracefully. Admin should coordinate with supply cap management before withdrawing."}},"notice":"Manages debt positions for overcollateralized mUSD borrowing. Uses utilization-based dynamic interest rates (Compound-style). Interest accrues per-second and is routed to SMUSD 746c2c4827c125d821ee796c74a676787762f4778671d4f44","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://1bb2332a7ee26dd0b0de9b7fe266749f54820c99ab6a3bcb6f7e6b751d47ee2d","dweb:/ipfs/QmcRWpaBeCYkhy68PR3B4AgD7asuQk7PwkWxrvJbZcikLF"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0x74ed01eb66b923d0d0cfe3be84604ac04b76482a55f9dd655e1ef4d367f95bc2","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://5282825a626cfe924e504274b864a652b0023591fa66f06a067b25b51ba9b303","dweb:/ipfs/QmeCfPykghhMc81VJTrHTC7sF6CRvaA1FXVq2pJhwYp1dV"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0x982c5cb790ab941d1e04f807120a71709d4c313ba0bfc16006447ffbd27fbbd5","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://8150ceb4ac947e8a442b2a9c017e01e880b2be2dd958f1fa9bc405f4c5a86508","dweb:/ipfs/QmbcBmFX66AY6Kbhnd5gx7zpkgqnUafo43XnmayAM7zVdB"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Context.sol":{"keccak256":"0x493033a8d1b176a037b2cc6a04dad01a5c157722049bbecf632ca876224dd4b2","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://6a708e8a5bdb1011c2c381c9a5cfd8a9a956d7d0a9dc1bd8bcdaf52f76ef2f12","dweb:/ipfs/Qmax9WHBnVsZP46ZxEMNRQpLQnrdE4dK8LehML1Py8FowF"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Pausable.sol":{"keccak256":"0xdb484371dfbb848cb6f5d70464e9ac9b2900e4164ead76bbce4fef0b44bcc68f","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://f9d6f6f6600a2bec622f699081b58350873b5e63ce05464d17d674a290bb8a7c","dweb:/ipfs/QmQKVzSQY1PM3Bid4QhgVVZyx6B4Jx7XgaQzLKHj38vJz8"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/ReentrancyGuard.sol":{"keccak256":"0x11a5a79827df29e915a12740caf62fe21ebe27c08c9ae3e09abe9ee3ba3866d3","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://3cf0c69ab827e3251db9ee6a50647d62c90ba580a4d7bbff21f2bea39e7b2f4a","dweb:/ipfs/QmZiKwtKU1SBX4RGfQtY7PZfiapbbu6SZ9vizGQD9UHjRA"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/introspection/ERC165.sol":{"keccak256":"0x2d9dc2fe26180f74c11c13663647d38e259e45f95eb88f57b61d2160b0109d3e","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://81233d1f98060113d9922180bb0f14f8335856fe9f339134b09335e9f678c377","dweb:/ipfs/QmWh6R35SarhAn4z2wH8SU456jJSYL2FgucfTFgbHJJN4E"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/introspection/IERC165.sol":{"keccak256":"0x8891738ffe910f0cf2da09566928589bf5d63f4524dd734fd9cedbac3274dd5c","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://971f954442df5c2ef5b5ebf1eb245d7105d9fbacc7386ee5c796df1d45b21617","dweb:/ipfs/QmadRjHbkicwqwwh61raUEapaVEtaLMcYbQZWs9gUkgj3u"]}},"version":1}

params.amount: Amount of mUSD to borrow (18 decimals)
Amount of mUSD to borrow (18 decimals)
Amount of bad debt to cover (mUSD, 18 decimals)

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

healthFactorUnsafe(address).details: Used by LiquidationEngine so liquidations proceed during >20% price crashes. Without this, healthFactor() reverts via getValueUsd() circuit breaker, blocking all liquidations exactly when they are most needed.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

params.user: The borrower whose remaining debt is uncollectible

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.amount: Amount of mUSD to repay (18 decimals) Removed whenNotPaused  users must always be able to repay debt, even during a pause, to avoid unfair liquidation from accruing interest.

repayFor(address,uint256).details: Allows LeverageVault to repay user debt when closing positions

params.amount: Amount of mUSD to repay (18 decimals) Removed whenNotPaused  repayment must always be available.
params.user: The user whose debt to repay

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

setTimelock(address).details: Must be called *through* the current timelock (i.e. scheduled +      executed as a normal timelocked operation).

socializeBadDebt(uint256,address[]).details: Socializes bad debt by proportionally reducing each active borrower's debt, maintaining the invariant sum(user_debts) == totalBorrows. Without proportional reduction, totalBorrows drops below user sums, breaking interest accrual math (overallocation via proportional share).

params.amount: Amount of bad debt to socialize
params.borrowers: Array of active borrower addresses whose debt should be reduced

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

totalDebt(address).details: Uses pos.principal + pos.accruedInterest (total debt) as interest base, matching _accrueInterest() execution. Previously used only pos.principal, causing the view to understate pending interest vs what _accrueInterest actually charges.

params.amount: Amount to withdraw Checks health BEFORE withdrawal (CEI pattern)

badDebt().notice: Accumulated bad debt from underwater liquidations (unbacked mUSD)

badDebtCovered().notice: Total bad debt covered by protocol reserves or external injection

borrowCapacity(address).notice: Get total borrow capacity for a user (public wrapper)

borrowFor(address,uint256).notice: Borrow mUSD on behalf of a user (for LeverageVault integration)

coverBadDebt(uint256).notice: Cover bad debt by burning mUSD from protocol reserves. Admin sends mUSD to this contract, which is burned to reduce the unbacked supply. Reduces the badDebt accumulator accordingly.

cumulativeBadDebt().notice: Total bad debt ever recorded (for analytics, never decremented)

getCurrentBorrowRate().notice: Get current annual borrow rate in BPS

getCurrentSupplyRate().notice: Get current annual supply rate in BPS

getTotalSupply().notice: Get total supply used for utilization calculation

getUtilizationRate().notice: Get current utilization rate in BPS

healthFactor(address).notice: Get health factor for a user (public view)

healthFactorUnsafe(address).notice: Health factor using unsafe oracle (bypasses circuit breaker)

interestRateBps().notice: Fallback fixed rate if model not set (legacy compatibility)

lastGlobalAccrualTime().notice: Last time global interest was accrued

maxBorrow(address).notice: Get maximum additional borrow amount for a user

recordBadDebt(address).notice: Record bad debt from underwater liquidation. Called by LiquidationEngine after a liquidation exhausts all collateral on a borrower who still has residual debt. Writes off the user's position and moves the shortfall into the badDebt accumulator.

reduceDebt(address,uint256).notice: Called by LiquidationEngine or LeverageVault to reduce a user's debt after seizure/emergency close Added nonReentrant to match all other state-modifying debt functions Allow LEVERAGE_VAULT_ROLE to call for emergency debt cleanup

repayFor(address,uint256).notice: Repay mUSD debt on behalf of a user (for LeverageVault integration)

setInterestRateModel(address).notice: Set interest rate model (timelocked via MintedTimelockController)

setMinDebt(uint256).notice: Set min debt threshold (timelocked via MintedTimelockController)

setTimelock(address).notice: Migrate to a new timelock controller.

smusd().notice: SMUSD vault to receive interest payments

socializeBadDebt(uint256,address[]).notice: Socialize remaining bad debt by reducing totalBorrows. This effectively distributes the loss across all borrowers by slightly reducing the interest base. Should only be used as a last resort when reserves are insufficient.

timelock().notice: Address of the MintedTimelockController that gates admin ops

totalBorrows().notice: Global total borrows across all users

totalDebt(address).notice: Get total debt (principal + accrued interest) for a user

totalInterestPaidToSuppliers().notice: Total interest paid to suppliers (for analytics)

unpause().notice: Unpause borrowing and repayments Require DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE for separation of duties

unroutedInterest().notice: Interest that accrued as debt but couldn't be minted (supply cap hit)

withdrawCollateral(address,uint256).notice: Withdraw collateral (only if position stays healthy)

withdrawReserves(address,uint256).notice: Withdraw accumulated protocol reserves Reserves are accounting entries for the protocol's share of interest. Instead of minting unbacked mUSD (which dilutes the peg), we try to mint within the supply cap. If the cap is hit, the withdrawal fails gracefully. Admin should coordinate with supply cap management before withdrawing.
